intro: Erucastrum erigavicum, commonly known as the erect sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, and its leaves are hairy and lobed. Erucastrum erigavicum is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and it is considered a weed in agricultural settings. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of the Brassicaceae family.
